item.title: Steps to Build and Deploy one Hugo Site
item.author: itspedia@itspedia.com (itspedia)
item.description:
Build one website locally by using Hugo

This can be done by following the guide, quick-start.

Deploy the website on GitHub repository

You can use GitHub Pages to host your hugo site.

Deploy the website on ECS

  • Have one ECS instance
  • Setup web server, like nginx, on this ECS instance
  • Use webhook and git to pull the static file from git repository the flag -secure is used to enable https access.

item.title: Learn to create a Hugo site in minutes
item.author: itspedia@itspedia.com (itspedia)
item.description:
Quick start

Learn to create a Hugo site in minutes.

In this tutorial you will:

  1. Create a site
  2. Add content
  3. Configure the site
  4. Publish the site

Prerequisites

Before you begin this tutorial you must:

  1. Install Hugo (extended or extended/deploy edition, v0.128.0 or later)
  2. Install Git

You must also be comfortable working from the command line.

Create a site

Commands

If you are a Windows user:

  • Do not use the Command Prompt
  • Do not use Windows PowerShell
  • Run these commands from PowerShell or a Linux terminal such as WSL or Git Bash

PowerShell and Windows PowerShell are different applications.
